Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you have to do better than that! It's like you're not even trying.
*sigh* How did I get roped into this?
You're the one that said you wanted to get a little more exercise.

Fields.MenuText: I was joking, clearly!
Well, I was wrong. I'm fine! I quit!
Yeah, I guess I did, didn't I?

Fields.DialogueText: Joking or not, we're doing it now, so don't waste my time!
No quitting in my house. You quit, you get off my ship.
Exactly, so get off your butt and let's get to it.
I just don't see how flipping and twirling through the halls like this is going to help me in the long run.
Flips and twirls are just the start, Kanchou.
It's all I ever see you doing.
Mmhmm, and look at me. I'm in perfect shape.
... Unfortunately, I can't argue with that.
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that, what horrible timing...
I heard that, Kanchou. We'll get back to this later.
@BATTLE
That's what I thought.
Kanchou, we need to change our heading!
What? What's going on?
We're getting a request for aid from a foreign civilian ship. They're under attack from a group of Funayūrei.

Fields.MenuText: So?
Then we need to hurry and help them.
How big is the group? Coming to someone's aid won't do us or them any good if we're overpowered as well.

Fields.DialogueText: So?! They might be out of our way, but as an INPF ship, it's our duty to help civilians.
Precisely my thinking. I'm glad we're on the same page.
I've no doubt we're up to this task, Kanchou.
How far off course will this take us?
Not far, I promise. We'll be back on course in no time.
I suppose that's one of the perks of you being one of the fastest ships in the fleet.
One of?
You're getting cocky. Don't we have a course to change?
@BATTLE
Is that Ikazuchi? What's she doing over there?
*murmurmurmur*
Ikazuchi? Are you all right?
Hmmm, oh! Kanchou! I didn't notice you there.

Fields.MenuText: My apologies, Ikazuchi. I wasn't trying to sneak up on you.
What's going on?
And I thought I was being so sneaky...

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right. I wasn't paying attention to my surroundings.
Not... much. Do you need something?
Heh, you'll have to do better than that if you want to catch me off guard.
What were you doing? Before you noticed me, I mean.
Praying for our vanquished enemies.
Praying for the Morganas?
They're our enemies, but... I believe they deserve peace as much as anyone else.
*ALARM*
Speaking of enemies.
That's what we get for talking about them, I suppose.
I doubt their ears were burning, but we can change that.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol ahead!
@BATTLE
I was supposed to take a call from the admiral ten minutes ago. She's going to kill me.
Woah! What's going on here?
Uh, Captain, sir? Is everything all right?
Why do we have barriers set up on deck?
The XO told us the deck was in need of a wax. The crew is preparing to start.

Fields.MenuText: I guess I'll find a way around...

Fields.DialogueText: Apologies for the inconvenience, sir!
Never mind, it's all right.
The next fastest way there would be through--
Uh, Kanchou! Uh, it's not what it looks like!
You're eating in storage? Any other time, I'd care, but right now, I have to get going. We're going to talk about this later.
It's not a snack! I wasn't eating it!
I don't care. I don't have time for this conversation.
... Okay?
This ship is ridiculous.

Fields.MenuText: Leave me a path next time.
Smells great.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Captain.
Right...
That was a manju you were eating before, wasn't it?
Oh, no.
I thought you didn't eat anything bad for you. I've never seen you take a drink, and you always leave the room when one of the officers starts smoking.
That's... correct.
And yet I saw you with that manju in storage.
It's not like that. I was...

Fields.MenuText: You were holding three, and there were bites taken out of each of them.
Okay, if you're going to make up some explanation, I should sit down and make myself comfortable first.
Stuffing your face? Yes, I saw. I was a little distracted, but I saw.

Fields.DialogueText: ... There really isn't any way to talk myself out of this, is there?
It's simple...  I... was holding them for a friend. Yes. That's it.
I wasn't stuffing my face, Kanchou. ... Oh, this is embarrassing.
Ikazuchi, there's nothing embarrassing about enjoying a snack every once in a while.
Really?
No one expects you to be perfect.
Okay then... I like to enjoy a tasty manju every now and then.
I'm proud of you for admitting that, Ikazuchi.
*ALARM*
Now if we're done exposing my eating habits, we have Funayūrei to take care of.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, are you ready for another training session?
You mean another session of spinning around until I'm sick?
More or less.
Ikazuchi, I'm too busy right now. You're going to have to go on without me.
You mean you're giving me permission to use the ship as my own personal tumbling mat?

Fields.MenuText: Did I say that? No, that's a horrible idea.
Just as long as you're careful.
Mmmm... if it'll get you to leave me alone, then go ahead.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, no taking it back now. You already said it!
I'll be so careful. I'll make sure to stay out of everyone's way.
Fair trade if you ask me.
If you change your mind and want to join me, I'll be around.
I definitely will not change my mind. That's for sure.
*ALARM*
I have too much to do.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, look! It's a sinking ship on the horizon!

Fields.MenuText: A ship? I'm not so sure about that.
I have no idea what you're talking about. I can't see anything.
You're right! And I think I can see some smoke coming off of it too.

Fields.DialogueText: What else would it be?
It's right there, Kanchou. Open your eyes!
It must've been attacked by Funayūrei.
We need to aid them.
Kanchou?
Are we sure that's a sinking ship?
We're sure!
... Okay. Let's go.
@BATTLE
A sinking ship, huh?
Okay, I was wrong. You can give me grief over the matter later.
Oh, I will.
Ikazuchi, do you have any more of that manju?
Hmmm? Manju? I don't know what you're talking about.
We've already gone over this, Ikazuchi. I know you have a stash.
Why are you asking?
I wanted to try some.
You've never had it?

Fields.MenuText: I've had it before, but I wanted to try some of yours.
No, never had the chance.
Never wanted to. But now I suppose it's piqued my interest.

Fields.DialogueText: Why? It's just normal manju.
Really? That's a shame.
Well, it's about time.
I suppose I can share a piece or two, but not too much. I don't have many left.
That's all I'm asking for.
Here.
You keep it on you?
At all times.
That's... a little strange.
*ALARM*
It's not strange.
We can argue about that later. Can't you hear the alarm?
It's not strange.
@BATTLE
Enemy sighted off the starboard bow!
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi? What are you staring at?
Anyway, we're making up the supply list for when we make port. Isn't there something you want to make sure we resupply for you?
What?
Manju.
Oh, right, yeah...  I'm just... do you see that little... dark spot off in the distance?

Fields.MenuText: Why do you keep asking me if I can see things far away? Are you testing my vision?
Could be Morganas. A few of them, even.
No, I don't see anything. Are you sure it's out there?

Fields.DialogueText: What? No, there's just a lot to see in the world. Now that you mention it, though...  Hm.
That's what I was thinking. It's curious.
I can see it. I'm sure. It looks like a group of Funayūrei.
A group of Funayūrei... just floating... not moving.
Do you think they need to be dealt with?
Not yet. It's more important that we resupply first.
What are you thinking?
It's just odd.
*SLAM*
What the hell was that?
Oooooh, ooooow...
Ikazuchi? What were you doing out there?
I slammed my head into your door...
Why? Why did you do that?
I didn't mean to...

Fields.MenuText: This is why we don't use the ship for gymnastics practice.
Are you okay? Do you need some ice?
Eh, you'll be fine. You have a hard head. Walk it off.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, yes, I've heard it all before.
I'll be fine. I've hit my head harder than that.
That's the plan. I just wanted to let you know, since it was your door I ran into.
You know, I think it might be a good idea if you kept the gymnastics confined to a specified area.
You know, I've had the same thought. But nah, I'll be fine. See you later, Kanchou!
Flipping right by the door she slammed her head into seconds earlier. She's pretty hard-headed.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Kanchou, did you hear?!

Fields.MenuText: About the port under attack?
About the toilet overflow in the men's head?

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly what I'm talking about.
What? Ew, no! There's a port under attack nearby.
You really should pay better attention, Kanchou. There's a port under attack nearby.
We need to aid them.
I agree. Our patrol can wait.
Really? I thought I might have to convince you.
Why would I be against helping people in need?
I'm glad you feel that way. I knew there was a reason why I liked you.
@BATTLE
Enemy sighted! Man your battle stations!
@BATTLE
Praying again?
I was just about to start.
I guess I have good timing, then.
Kanchou, you look like you have something you want to ask me.

Fields.MenuText: Do you really think praying for Morganas is going to do any good?
It must be strange... praying for Morganas.
No, no. I'm fine.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not why I do it. It's a form of respect. I respect my enemies, especially the mighty ones.
Not for me. It's just my way to show respect to my foes after a battle.
Very well. You know, if you'd ever like to join me in my prayers, you'd be more than welcome.
Well, I'll let you get to it. I have my own way of showing respect for the Morganas.
Paperwork and reports?
You guessed it.
I appreciate the offer. I'll keep that in mind.
Great, more Morganas...
@BATTLE
Well, well, Ikazuchi! Look what's listed as having been brought on board. A crate of manju!
Hm? Oh, good.
Ikazuchi? What's going on?
Look on the horizon. They're back.
Oh, those are definitely Morganas, and there's a good helping of them now.
The group is getting larger.

Fields.MenuText: We should challenge them now.
What do you think we should do?
Hopefully someone does something about them.

Fields.DialogueText: No, there's a smarter way to deal with them.
We need to come up with a plan. There are too many to take on at once...
Someone? Something? We're that someone, Kanchou. Don't you understand that?
Once the crew is finished with the resupply, we'll approach the horde.
We'd better have a plan by then.
We will.
All right, where are they, Kanchou?
Where are what?
The crew ratted you out. They told me you snagged the supply of manju as soon as it was brought on board.

Fields.MenuText: The crew is a bunch of liars. I should know. I'm their captain.
Okay, I'll admit it. I took them.
Manju? That's that... ammunition we use with that new gun, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Which would make you the king of liars. Untrustworthy. Conniving...
Good. Now give them to me.
Don't play stupid with me. We both know what I'm talking about.
*sigh* I only took it to protect you from yourself.
Protect me from what? Deliciousness?
From yourself. I was worried you'd see the box and eat them all in one sitting.
I'm not a-- oh my, that's a big box!
*ALARM*
Hey, get your head on straight. We have company.
But, but... manju.
We'll celebrate with it after.
Fine. Let's make this quick.
@BATTLE
So that's the plan. It should work if we're careful enough. Understand?

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry, were you talking this whole time? I wasn't paying attention.
It should work, but let's go over it one more time.
We've got this. That horde is as good as gone.

Fields.DialogueText: You are a horrible person. Always pay attention to the person talking to you.
Just to be safe? Smart thinking.
Don't get so cocky, Kanchou. Let's go over it one more time.
We'll swoop in, draw some attention with a few shots, then make a speedy retreat. Hopefully,  we'll lure a fraction of the force away with us.
A small fraction.
But not too small.
We don't want the majority of them chasing us.
You don't think we could handle that?
Do you?
Realistically... no. I suppose not.
*ALARM*
But we should be able to handle these Funayūrei without issue.
@BATTLE
All right, we're approaching the Funayūrei, Kanchou.
It looks like the horde's gotten even bigger.
Are you nervous?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I am!
Not even one bit.
Are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, at least you're honest about it.
Hmmm, me neither. We just need to stick to the plan.
That was avoiding the question, Kanchou. But no, I'm plenty confident our plan will work.
Ikazuchi, Captain, we're stepping foot into firing range.
You hear that? It's about to begin.
Let's pull the trigger and see how many we can reel in.
Sounds like a plan. Fire!
Yes, ma'am.
*BOOM*
The Funayūrei are looking our way.
Let's get out of here and bring some of them with us.
Double time!
@BATTLE
Well, that went according to plan.
Better than planned, actually. We lured away a larger portion of the group than I was expecting.
Really? I'm glad the entire plan didn't end up blowing up in our faces.
Wait, Kanchou. Look. The remainder of the horde is moving.
I think that's what hordes do.
No, they've been moving in a pattern this entire time. Now they're deviating!
I see why. Look at that convoy to the west.
Even with reduced numbers, those Funayūrei could lay waste to those ships.
You're not wrong.
We have to help.

Fields.MenuText: Uh, no, we don't.
You're right. Let's step in.
We have a plan, Ikazuchi.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, they'll be consumed by those Funayūrei if we do nothing.
I knew you'd see things my way. Thank you, Kanchou.
Plans change. Especially when lives and ships are in danger.
Do I have permission to change our heading?
... Yes. Do it.
This... this might blow up in our faces.
@BATTLE
The convoy was able to escape, Kanchou, but...
We have the entire horde breathing down our necks now, don't we?
Exactly.
This isn't good.
If we keep running, we might be able to escape their grasp.
Maybe, but...
Do you have a different plan?
If we steer toward those shoals there, we might stand a better chance.
We would have to be careful not to run aground, but some of the horde will almost certainly turn back rather than risk their ships.
Captain, the Morganas are approaching. Do we have a plan?
What do you think, Ikazuchi?
Let's do it.
We'd best be on our way, then.
We don't have a moment to waste.
@BATTLE
Time to whittle down this horde.
@BATTLE
Praying again?
We're lucky to be alive and afloat, Kanchou. Those Funayūrei earned our respect.

Fields.MenuText: Hmmm... you're not wrong.
You're right. Maybe I'll join you.
We deserve respect after defeating a horde of that size.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you see it that way. Would you like to join me?
Please do. There's always room at my side.
We're given plenty of respect without giving it to ourselves.
Please, Kanchou, just sit here for a moment and collect your thoughts. Think about our battle and appreciate the enemy's tactics and strength.
That's all there is to these prayers of yours?
Hai. That's it.
Well, if you insist.
Shhh.
Now that I think about it, this seems a lot like what I do on paper after every skirmish.
Kanchou?
Oh, right. "Shhh."
Are you sure this plan will still work, Ikazuchi?
Why wouldn't it?
Well, they might have figured out our plan after our last encounter with them.
You really think Funayūrei are that intelligent?

Fields.MenuText: You're the one who's always going on about respecting our enemies.
I've certainly encountered Morgans I'd consider clever.
No, but there's always a chance.

Fields.DialogueText: I respect their combat prowess. But I'm not going to ask them to handle complex math equations any time soon.
Clever or not, I like our odds.
I'd need more than a chance possibility to change my plans.
*ALARM*
The alarm? We haven't even fired yet!
*BOOM*
No, but they're firing on us!
What? Are we even in range?
No, but they're coming our way anyway.
We wanted to get their attention, and we certainly did that.
Then we fight!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, whoa! Kanchou, are you okay?
Too... much... manju...
How many did you eat?
I stopped counting... a while ago. Ghhgh.
You'd better not vomit in front of me.
It's... it's okay. I won't, I think.
The art of eating manju is a delicate thing. You were clearly not prepared.

Fields.MenuText: What do you know? I'll eat what I want!
You're right about that...  I'll leave the manju to you.
But it's so good!

Fields.DialogueText: That's the manju talking. I forgive you, Kanchou.
Now, now, don't give up on manju entirely, Kanchou.
It truly is. I shouldn't have to tell you that too much of a good thing can be bad for you.
*ALARM*
Oh, good grief. The Morganas have the worst timing. Gheurp.
Don't you dare throw up now! You'll have to hold it in until after the battle.
I can do this... Urp. I can do this.
Uck.
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, you're eyeing the horde again?
It's really not large enough to be called a horde anymore. It's more of a group now.
True enough. A smattering, if you will.
I think it's time we show them we're not to be trifled with. What do you think, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: The sooner the better, if you ask me.
You're sure about that?
Seems scary.

Fields.DialogueText: Then we shouldn't waste any time.
Well, if we tried to draw them out again, we'd probably lure them all to us.
Don't be a baby, Kanchou. You have me. I'll protect you.
If you're sure about this, we should make certain we're properly supplied.
That's an excellent idea, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Though first, we have a few stray Morganas to fend off.
What else is new?
@BATTLE
This is it, Kanchou. No turning back after we rush in there.

Fields.MenuText: Why would we want to turn back? As long as there are Morganas to gun down in front of us, it's full speed ahead.
You know, this is more nerve-wracking than I expected!
Do you think we're ready?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, I like your enthusiasm. Let's just make sure we're not gunned down in the process.
Calm down, Kanchou. You have nothing to worry about. We've prepared for this.
I think we're as ready as we can be. And that's all we can ask for.
Those are the leaders there, Kanchou. If we take them down, the rest should be a piece of cake.
You know, they're smaller than I was expecting.
But they're fast. Not as fast as I am, but nothing is.
Yes, yes, I get it, you're incredible. Can you pat yourself on the back some other time?
Excellent idea. Let's get going.
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, the battle has been won. Why are we still lingering here?
One more moment, Kanchou. I'm sure there's something we're not seeing.
But what are you looking for?
I don't know. I'll know it when I see it.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, take all the time you need.
We need to make it back to port. We shouldn't waste time out here just because you might spot something.
Are you maybe looking for Morgana parts? Because I'm seeing a lot of those.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou. I'll try not to be much longer.
I know, I'm sorry. I just have this sinking feeling in my stomach. I can't help it.
No, not just parts. I'm looking for something special.
You have to admit. There was something odd about that Funayūrei behavior.
How so? Nothing seemed too out of the ordinary.
Hmmm... maybe I'm putting too much thought into this.
*ALARM*
Great, more of them?
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I guess I took too long.
Nothing to do about it now. Let's just make sure we head back to port after we take care of these new arrivals.
All right. Maybe it was just my imagination after all.
@BATTLE
Another wave of Morganas!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, are you ready to celebrate our victory?

Fields.MenuText: I'm always up for a party!
That depends on what you have planned.
... What's the catch?

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't exactly thinking a party, Kanchou. I had something else in mind.
Well, I could tell you, but I'd rather it be a surprise.
No, no catch. I just made you something to commemorate our victory.
Tell me what you have planned, Ikazuchi.
All right, here it is. I made some manju myself, from scratch. I wanted to share it with you.
Ghghghghghhh.
Kanchou, are you okay? Your face is turning green.
I'm fine, it's just... ghghghhgh... no, no more manju, please. Not for a while.
That's just rude! Fine, more for me.
Oh, good lord, just watching you eating it is making me... ughughghg.
If you're going to get sick, don't do it on my manju.
No promises.
Well, I'll go back to my post and leave you to your retching, then.
I really do appreciate the thought, I'm sorry, I'm... ugh!
I never thought manju could do something so horrible.
